35232142: Repair work is ongoing in areas affected by flooding in Scotland, with calls for more preventative measures and immediate steps for flood protection plans.
40143035: A fire at the Holiday Inn in Northern Ireland destroyed two tour buses, prompting police to investigate the suspected deliberate attack.
35951548: Mercedes outpaced Ferrari in Bahrain Grand Prix qualifying, with Lewis Hamilton securing pole position despite a reprimand, while debutant Stoffel Vandoorne impressed by out-qualifying Jenson Button.
36266422: John Edward Bates faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, denying all allegations made by four male complainants of sexual abuse during his time as a scout leader.
38826984: Patients and staff were evacuated from Cerahpasa hospital after a man receiving treatment threatened to shoot himself and others, but earlier reports of hostages were incorrect.
34540833: Simone Favaro scored the crucial try in the last move of the game as Glasgow Warriors defeated the Dragons in a messy match.
20836172: Veronica Vanessa Chango-Alverez, 31, was killed in a hit-and-run in Streatham High Road, London, and police are seeking the driver who fled the scene.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Demoitie died after a collision with a motorbike during Belgium's Gent-Wevelgem race, sparking concerns about safety in road racing.
40758845: Manchester City's Ilkay Gundogan is optimistic about his recovery from injury and eager to return to the field for the upcoming Premier League season.
30358490: A man in his 20s was airlifted to the hospital after a crash at the junction of A127 and Progress Road in Leigh-on-Sea, Essex.
34615665: The first major tropical storm to hit mainland Mexico since 1959 reaches the highest rating, prompting questions about how storm categories are determined.
35890902: Security firm Bastille Networks discovered vulnerabilities in wireless mice that allowed attackers to spoof signals and take control of computers, prompting updates from some manufacturers.
37922330: 38 staff at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell face redundancies as the business goes into administration, with hopes for some to find jobs at another nearby firm.
30844962: The European Commission has doubts about Luxembourg's tax arrangement with Amazon, suspecting it may constitute state aid and violate EU rules.
36217333: The Balmoral Show celebrates agricultural life with farming, food, family fun, and local produce, featuring livestock showcases and family-friendly activities.
30816523: Max Mosley is suing Google for breaching his privacy by refusing to block images of him at a sex party.
38900884: Bath-born player Eddie Jackson's injury is a big blow for Dragons, but it presents an opportunity for other players to step up.
13890581: The Cornish Language Partnership receives three-year funding package to ensure language survival, with emphasis on long-term support from Cornwall.
40194700: Monaco's coach Leonardo Jardim described the last three years at the club as "exceptional" and chose to continue the adventure at Monaco despite other coaching offers.
37903647: The State Department criticized Nicaragua's election process as flawed and not free and fair, with President Ortega winning by a large margin amidst opposition allegations of voter abstention.
13291223: South African authorities have announced plans to address the issue of "corrective rape" against lesbians following the recent killing of activist Noxolo Nogwaza.
36052570: Big oil producing nations meet in Qatar to discuss a freeze in production levels, but there is skepticism over its impact on the oversupply of oil in the market.
34944735: The vibrant blue color in tarantulas has evolved independently at least eight times, suggesting an important visual signaling function beyond sexual selection.
32159602: Andreas Lubitz's internet searches included information on suicide and cockpit security before intentionally crashing Flight 9525, killing all 150 people on board.
34988915: Former radio DJ Mr Fox denies multiple counts of indecent and sexual assault, claiming all behavior was consensual and part of workplace "horseplay."
37889203: Tottenham's Mauricio Pochettino confirmed that 20-year-old Dele Alli will be sidelined for "a few weeks" due to a knee injury sustained in training.
33609927: The Jehovah's Witnesses' explicit policy of dealing with abuse in-house has led to difficulties in bringing abusers to justice, as highlighted by a survivor's story.
33578778: Yanis Varoufakis criticizes Greece's bailout program as a historic disaster, while the German parliament approves negotiations for an €86bn bailout in exchange for austerity measures.
36888270: The IPC opened proceedings against the National Paralympic Committee of Russia for alleged doping, with a decision on any ban expected in early August.
36846007: Ben has joined the Exiles with his Championship experience, as director of rugby Nick Kennedy praises the acquisition.
31723471: Manor F1 team, which went into administration in October, has secured investment from Stephen Fitzpatrick and appointed Justin King as interim chairman, aiming to be competitive in the upcoming season.
15921828: The Welsh government agreed on a £39m stimulus package to boost the economy, but opposition parties criticized it as inadequate and called for different allocations of the funds.
39109408: Former UK Prime Minister Sir John Major warns of substantial costs and unpalatable consequences of leaving the EU, urging for more charm and less cheap rhetoric from the government.
20936833: Labour opposes the Welfare Benefits Uprating Bill, arguing it will harm working families, while the coalition insists it is necessary to reduce the deficit and fair given public sector pay constraints.
36832879: Engineers are working to repair a collapsed sewer under the railway tracks in Forest Hill, causing disruptions to train services in London until Wednesday.
14958201: Manchester City defeated Everton with late goals from substitutes Mario Balotelli and James Milner, showcasing their patience and persistence in overcoming Everton's defensive tactics.
34352262: Nicola Sturgeon claimed to have met the target of reducing six-week delays in discharging patients, but Labour criticized her for not meeting it for over three years.
39805395: The European Court of Justice ruled that overflow pipes at the Burry Inlet in Wales broke clean water laws, leading to a £113m project to reduce spills and improve water quality by 2020.
34303109: Pope Francis visits Cuba, praising improved US-Cuba ties and urging support for Cuban Catholics, before heading to the US.
39939090: Rangi Chase joins Widnes after being dropped by Castleford, eager to make an impact and play regularly for the struggling team.
29347771: Cricket Scotland's chief executive Roddy Smith is stepping down after 10 years, leaving behind a growing and successful organization with plans for a new "world class" base in Stirling.
36783415: Sunderland want Allardyce to stay as manager despite speculation linking him to the vacant England job, urging the FA to resolve the matter swiftly.
37935687: Wales narrowly defeated Argentina with a late penalty, securing a four-point victory in a match that did not meet expectations.
40260829: New Zealand troops carved the Bulford Kiwi near Stonehenge, and Historic England has made it a scheduled monument along with a model of the Battle of Messines.
36478199: Prison report reveals inmate ran down landing with keys at HMP Wayland, leading to transfer to higher security jail and additional time added to sentences.
34541803: Tim Sherwood deserves more time as Aston Villa manager despite early-season struggles and player departures, given his leadership qualities and ability to improve players.
35360841: Transport Minister Edwina Hart aims to streamline the system, cut fraud, and address the rise in rejections of transportation assistance in Wales.
35550407: Life expectancy for older adults in England varies across regions, with concerns about elderly people living in poor health and a need to address worsening health in some areas.
37561590: Operation Equinox is investigating decades of abuse in Nottinghamshire, with hundreds of reported crimes on council property and involving council staff.
39328843: The Women's FA Cup quarter-final draw sees Chelsea facing Sunderland, Manchester City against Bristol City, and Liverpool hosting Notts County, with the final set for May 13 at Wembley.
